Mayor's Office

Mayor's Office
==============

|  |  |
| --- | --- |
| ![Mayor Mattie Parker](https://www.fortworthtexas.gov/files/assets/public/v/1/mayor-headshot-update.png?w=500&h=658 "Mayor Mattie Parker") | Mattie Parker was elected in June 2021 as the 45th Mayor of Fort Worth. Leading one of the fastest-growing large cities in the nation, Parker has set her focus on key issues that move Fort Worth forward, including economic development growth, innovative transportation and mobility solutions, quality education opportunities for every student, and building safer, more prosperous communities.  [Read More   »](https://www.fortworthtexas.gov/government/elected-officials/mattie-parker) |

Contact the Mayor

Expand the arrow below to access the Meeting or Event Appearance Request form or Email the Mayor form.

(show below)
Email the Mayor
---------------

(show below)

[![](https://www.fortworthtexas.gov/files/assets/public/v/1/mayors-podcast-color-alt-rgb-2.jpg?dimension=largethumbnail&w=480&h=316)

Go Time in Fort Worth with Mayor Mattie Parker
----------------------------------------------

In the Go Time podcast, Mayor Mattie Parker sits down with Fort Worth’s innovators, business leaders, and changemakers; shares what’s on her mind as Mayor of one of the largest and fastest growing cities in the nation; and brings together differing viewpoints to have conversations on topics that matter.](https://www.fortworthtexas.gov/government/mayor/go-time)

[![](https://www.fortworthtexas.gov/files/assets/public/v/1/government/images/mayor-parker/mayors-council-education-workforce-cover-size.png?dimension=largethumbnail&w=480&h=316)

Mayor's Council on Education & Workforce
----------------------------------------

The Mayor’s Council on Education & Workforce was launched in 2022 to influence and enhance educational programs and career pathways in Fort Worth public schools to help prepare students for their future careers, including careers that help meet the current and future needs of business and industry in Fort Worth and North Texas.](https://www.fortworthtexas.gov/government/mayor/mayors-council-education-workforce)

[![](https://www.fortworthtexas.gov/files/assets/public/v/2/government/images/mayor-parker/green-space-homepage.png?dimension=largethumbnail&w=480&h=316)

Good Natured
------------

Mayor Mattie Parker has created Good Natured, a Fort Worth Greenspace Partnership and bold investment in natural community spaces.](https://www.fortworthtexas.gov/government/mayor/good-natured)

[Email](mailto:?Body=https%3a%2f%2fwww.fortworthtexas.gov%2fgovernment%2fmayor)

[Title VI and Accessibility & Accommodations](https://www.fortworthtexas.gov/departments/hr/civil-right-office/title-VI-accessibility-accommodations)
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Accommodations are available for residents who have accessibility requirements. To learn more about accessibility accommodations available from the City of Fort Worth, visit the
[Accessibility page](https://www.fortworthtexas.gov/departments/hr/civil-right-office/title-VI-accessibility-accommodations)
.
due to disability.
